title: Job Openings at Ultraviolet Microfinance Bank
content:
Ultraviolet Microfinance Bank is recruiting qualified candidates to fill the following positions below:

1.) Head of Operations

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full Time

Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Oversee daily banking operations, including account opening, loan processing, and transaction handling.
	Ensure smooth and efficient operation of all branches and service outlets.
	Develop and implement operational policies and procedures to improve efficiency and service quality.
	Ensure a high level of customer satisfaction by delivering exceptional service and resolving customer complaints promptly.
	Implement customer feedback mechanisms to continuously improve service quality.
	Develop strategies to enhance customer experience and build long-term relationships.
	Lead, mentor, and motivate the operations team to achieve performance goals.
	Conduct performance evaluations and provide training and development opportunities for team members.
	Foster a positive and productive work environment that encourages teamwork and collaboration.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@ultravioletmfb.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

2.) Business Development Manager

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full Time

Responsibilities


	Conduct thorough market analysis to identify trends, customer needs, and potential business opportunities.
	Develop and implement strategic business development plans to achieve company growth targets.
	Monitor competitor activity and industry developments to stay ahead in the market.
	Identify and approach potential clients through cold calls, emails, networking, and industry events.
	Develop and maintain strong relationships with existing clients to ensure repeat business and long-term partnerships.
	Manage the sales pipeline and convert leads into profitable accounts.
	Prepare compelling business proposals, presentations, and pitches tailored to client needs.
	Negotiate contracts and close deals in line with company pricing policies and revenue goals.
	Ensure smooth onboarding of new clients in collaboration with internal departments.
	Set monthly, quarterly, and annual sales targets and ensure they are achieved.
	Maintain accurate records of business development activities using CRM tools.
	Generate regular reports on sales performance, client feedback, and market insights.
	Work closely with marketing, product development, and customer service teams to align goals and improve client offerings.
	Provide feedback to the product or service teams to support innovation and client satisfaction.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@ultravioletmfb.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

3.) Investment / Private Banking Officer

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full Time

Key Responsibilities    


	Develop and maintain strong, long-term relationships with existing and prospective high-net-worth clients.
	Serve as the primary point of contact for all banking, investment, and wealth management needs.
	Conduct regular portfolio reviews and adjust strategies based on changing client objectives.
	Proactively identify and pursue opportunities to grow the client base through referrals, networking, and targeted outreach.
	Develop and execute strategies for client acquisition and retention.
	Provide tailored financial solutions including investment advice, estate planning, tax-efficient strategies, and credit solutions.
	Collaborate with in-house specialists (e.g., investment advisors, trust officers, legal advisors) to deliver holistic wealth management services.
	Ensure all client transactions and activities comply with internal policies and regulatory requirements (e.g., KYC, AML).
	Monitor client portfolios for potential risks and implement appropriate measures.
	Ensure timely and efficient handling of client requests, inquiries, and complaints.
	Provide personalized, high-touch service that enhances client satisfaction and loyalty.


Salary
N300,000 - N400,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@ultravioletmfb.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

4.) Executive Assistant

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full Time

Key Responsibilities    


	Manage the executive’s calendar, schedule meetings, and coordinate appointments, ensuring efficient time management.
	Prepare and edit correspondence, reports, presentations, and other documents.
	Act as a gatekeeper, screen calls, and prioritize communication.
	Organize and attend meetings, take minutes, and follow up on action items.
	Coordinate logistics for internal and external meetings, conferences, and events.
	Serve as the primary point of contact between the executive and internal/external stakeholders.
	Maintain professionalism and discretion in handling confidential information.
	Draft and manage communications on behalf of the executive.
	Ensure the executive is well-prepared for all engagements.
	Arrange domestic and international travel, including flights, accommodations, and itineraries.
	Prepare travel expense reports and ensure timely reimbursements.
	Organize and maintain files and records, both physical and digital.
	Manage executive office supplies and support the day-to-day administrative operations.
	Assist with special projects and perform other duties as assigned.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@ultravioletmfb.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Downstream Operations and Sales Support Officer Job at TeamAce Limited




        
    

        
        TeamAce Limited  - Our client, an Oil & Gas company, is recruiting suitably qualified candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Downstream Operations and Sales Support Officer

Job Locations: Abuja (FCT) and Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time (Hybrid)

Job Summary


	As a Downstream Operations and Sales Support you will be responsible for identifying business opportunities, coordinating the tendering process, engaging OEMs and manufacturers, and overseeing delivery logistics for products and services across the oil and gas value chain.


Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Identify and pursue new business opportunities with government agencies, IOCs, and EPC contractors.
	Prepare and submit EOIs, RFQs, and tenders in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders.
	Liaise with local and international manufacturers for procurement of production chemicals, drilling fluids, and marine support equipment.
	Track and manage project delivery schedules and ensure timely execution of supply contracts.
	Support the operational team in coordinating logistics and ensuring compliance with safety and regulatory requirements.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Petroleum Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Industrial Chemistry, or related field.
	2–5 years of experience in the oil & gas industry (business development, tendering, field operations, or supply chain).
	Strong understanding of petroleum product supply, drilling fluids, and offshore/onshore operations.
	Proven experience in responding to public or private sector procurement requests (EOIs, RFQs, RFPs).
	Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint); ERP or CRM systems experience is a plus.


Salary
N250,000 – N350,000  / Month.
